title: What are some good violin solo pieces that don’t need a piano accompaniment? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the violin literature there are quite a few pieces for solo playing. In the Baroque period JS Bach and G Telemann contributed fine music for a solo violin. In the 20th century I Stravinsky and (especially) P Hindemith produced many solo pieces for the violin or the viola. Even some of the Etudes of composers are exceptionally musical.
How about Bach’s Sonata for Solo Violin in Gm? I am learning it on guitar (Presto part), but I imagine the piece is definitely better suited on violin!
